      • getOverlappingLength

        public static double getOverlappingLength(IPolygon poly1,
                                          IPolygon poly2)
        Computes the distance of overlaping between buildings, along the axis joining the two centers of gravity.
        Parameters:
        poly1 - First overlapping geometry
        poly2 - Second overlapping geometry
        Returns:
        Length of overlap between the two geometries in the direction defined by the two centres of gravity. Returns 0 if the two polygons are disjoint.

      • angleBetween2Lines

        public static double angleBetween2Lines(ILineString line1,
                                        ILineString line2)
        Computes the angle between two crossing lines. The angle is not directly computed between the first vertices after the crossing to avoid capture artifacts.
        Parameters:
        line1 - the first line of the angle
        line2 - the second line of the angle
        Returns:
        an Angle object between [0, Pi]

                                            IDirectPosition point)

        Parameters:
        line - the line on which orientation is computed
        point - thr point where orientation is computed
        Returns:
        an Angle object corresponding to the absolute orientation [0,2Pi]

        Returns:

      • getMeanLine

        public static ILineString getMeanLine(ILineString line1,
                                      ILineString line2)
        Compute the mean line between two lines. It's a very simple algorithm that may not work in complex cases like for instance lines that intersect. It loops on the points of the first line and searches the closest point on line 2, and takes the middle of both points.
        Parameters:
        line1 -
        line2 -
        Returns:

      • getSelfIntersections

        public static List<IDirectPosition> getSelfIntersections(ILineString line)
        Compute the self intersections of a line string ordered according the line vertices order. Intersections can lie on vertices or between two vertices. Uses a non-optimal method.
        Parameters:
        line -
        Returns:
